title: Sour crypto mood could fuel an ‘unexpected rally’ this month: Santiment
summary: Crypto market sentiment remains fearful as the broader market continues to slump, but that could be a good thing, as weak hands sell off, Santiment argued.

title: Tokenization demand is no longer tied to Bitcoin: Galaxy executive
summary: Galaxy tokenization head Thomas Cowan says interest in tokenization is now “independent of the price of Bitcoin” as institutions have started to see the benefits.

title: Funding bill set to reopen US government heads to Trump’s desk
summary: The House passed a funding bill to end the longest US government shutdown in history, which had previously delayed crypto ETF approvals and key crypto bills.

title: Bitwise’s exec says 2026 will be crypto’s real bull year, here’s why
summary: With crypto markets failing to meaningfully rally toward the end of 2025, this only sets up 2026 for more upside, according to Bitwise’s Matt Hougan.

title: 3 reasons Bitcoin struggles to overcome each new overhead resistance level
summary: Bitcoin’s momentum loss continues as long-term holders add to market selling pressure, and rising US dollar strength leads investors to reduce their exposure to risk.

title: Bitcoin’s 4-year cycle is broken, and this time, data proves it
summary: Data shows that BTC’s “average annual returns have gradually declined, with no peaks at all in the last cycle, confirming the hypothesis that Bitcoin's risk/return structure has changed.”

title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
summary: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

title: IBM claims major leap toward quantum computers with new chips
summary: IBM targets quantum advantage by 2026 and fault-tolerant systems by 2029 with new processors and faster error correction, advancing the race toward quantum computing.

title: Bitcoin Depot enters Hong Kong as part of Asian expansion
summary: The largest Bitcoin ATM operator in North America is expanding to Hong Kong, citing growing global demand for cash-to-crypto access.

title: Bitdeer in flames: Ohio mining facility fire extends stock sell-off
summary: The incident at the Massillon, Ohio, facility followed the company's Q3 earnings report on Monday, showing a net loss of over $266 million.
